short_summary: TBIPS \/ SPICT - Desktop Modernization for a Cloud Managed Desktop
description:
The Department of Global Affairs Canada has identified a need for multiple Network Analysts and Technology Architects Level 3 with a secret clearance to provide support for the IM/IT transformation initiatives for the Application Modernization programme in the delivery of Desktop Modernization for a Cloud Managed Desktop. The purpose of these services is to provide the next generation of endpoints, (desktops, laptops) to enhance the management, security and access to the end user. 

The Contracting Entity address is located at 200 prom du Portage, Gatineau QC J8X 4B7.

The deadline to submit the Tender description document is 2023-12-04 14:00:00.

The  Section B - Procurement Method, of the Tender Description Document, outlines the conditions for eligibility and the terms and conditions of the contract.

Key Application Deadline is 2023-12-04.
duration_in_months: If awarded, an estimated 1-year contract period with two (2) option periods of 12 months each will be provisioned by the Contract Authorities.

full_summary:
### Desktop Modernization for Cloud Managed Desktop

#### Background

Global Affairs Canada (GAC) has identified a requirement for the modernization of desktops to a cloud-managed desktop environment. This project is part of the Operations Modernization Programme to enhance the management, security, and access for end-users.

#### Scope

The objective of this project is to provide the next generation of endpoints (desktops and laptops) to meet industry standards and to support existing configuration management solutions. The scope includes:

* Analysis and design to integrate business requirements and support horizontal transformation initiatives.
* Development of next-generation endpoints managed in the cloud, with the intent to develop a co-managed model for on-premise devices.
* Configuration management tools will be provided as SAAS products, requiring an integrated solution for managing all devices.

#### Requirements

* Network Analysts and Technology Architects Level 3 with a Secret clearance.
* Required expertise includes:
	+ Network Analyst L3
	+ Technology Architect L3

#### Invitation to Tender

Selected Supply Arrangement Holders have been invited to submit a proposal for this opportunity. The deadline for submission is [2023-12-04T14:00:00].

#### Security Requirements

* Common PS SRCL #19 applies
* Minimum Corporate Security Required: SECRET
* Minimum Resource Security Required: SECRET

#### Contract Details

* Estimated contract duration: 12 months, with possible 2 option periods of 12 months each.
* Estimated start date: [2024-01-02]
* Estimated delivery date: [2025-01-01]

#### Procurement Method

* Competitive - Selective tendering
* Solicitation method: RFP against Supply Arrangement

#### Trade Agreements

* The Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* The Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)

#### Contact Information

* Contracting Authority: Betty Woodman
* Phone number: (343) 203-6922
* Email address: betty.woodman@international.gc.ca

#### Notice of Proposed Procurement

This notice is issued under the context of the TBIPS (Task Based Informatics Professional Services). For more information on the TBIPS methodology and to become a qualified supply arrangement holder, please contact RCNMDAI-NCRIMOS@pwgsc.gc.ca. 



Advise her to review the full Solicitation document for additional
